Address: 122 W Liberty St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Upbeat watering hole featuring local beer on tap & a menu of hearty sandwiches & Southwestern fare.

summary.snippet: "Atmosphere, good food and service just off Main."
"My chicken was dry, the wrap was hard to chew, fries were good though."
"The fish n chips were realllllllly good and our server was nice and easy going."

most_relevant.description: Great service. A staple in town. Beautiful place. Food is great. Some nice vegetarian options. Turkey Reuben is delicious. Nice beer options

A nice selection of food on the menu. The pot roast was excellent, tender meat, skin on mashed potatoes and a mixture of tasty seasoned mixed vegetables, a wonderful tempeh Reuben, crispy sweet potato fries and a nice cole slaw.

Delicious burgers! I was driving around looking for something to eat and ran across this bar. I'm glad I came in and I'll definitely be back. The bar was neat too. There is a lot of neat things on the wall to look at.

This has been my favorite bar in Ann Arbor since I walked in the first time.  The food is solid, the drinks are made with love and attention, and the company is rich.  Old Town is simply the only place I know for sure I am going back.

Management and staff are awesome, food was great! Mara behind the bar was a total sweetheart and her service was excellent. Less yuppie then the rest of the street, clean, chill laid back, and a great vibe!
The waiters were fighting for their life on a Friday night, but prices are decent and the food was good. Food did take about half an hour. It was pretty busy but I was still surprised. Friendly staff
Stopped in here on a weeknight while in Ann Arbor for work and thought it was great! Awesome tavern/divey vibes, the staff were all super nice and they make a solid black and tan.
We stopped by for the 50th anniversary. The atmosphere was amazing and service was very prompt and friendly. We have not eaten here yet so I cannot read food but I will be back again for sure.
